proposal: #123 - Batch of HRMP Channels with Statemint
rationale: This proposal will open HRMP channels between Statemint and parachains Litentry, Composable, Polkadex and Zeitgeist.
details: Opening new HRMP channels with Statemint will enable those 4 parachains to use assets on Statemint, such as stablecoin USDT. That's we voted AYE.

proposal: #214 - Further decentralize collator set on Kusama system chains
rationale: This proposal aims to decentralize the following system chains â€“ Kusama Asset Hub (former Statemine) and Kusama Bridge Hub.
details: We support this proposal for increasing the number of decentralized collators of Kusama Asset Hub and Kusama Bridge Hub.

proposal: #213 - Moving a paraid to a new manager address - Kabocha
rationale: This proposal seeks community input on technical feasibility and support for Kabocha.
details: We support this proposal for technical feasibility and potential community benefits.

rationale: This propoasl asks for retroactive funding for the development of the Encointer, a common good parachain on Kusama.
details: Encointer has amazing and inovative usecase, bringing adoption to the local communitites and we fully support that approach, so that's why we voted AYE on this referenda.

rationale: XCM Transactor pallet had an issue in which it crafted an XCM V3 message that could not be converted to XCM V2.
details: Our intention is to help Moonbeam to entact the referendum 95, so why voted AYE to this fast-tracking proposal by Tech-Committee and the Council.

rationale: Accepting HRMP channel open request from Moonbeam is the final step to have GLMR in the Omnipool.
details: Opening channels and allowing trading blue chip tokens like GLMR is amazing achievement for HydraDX Omnipool, so that's we voted AYE.

proposal: #64 - CP51: Onboarding the 2nd batch of collators
rationale: This referendum will onboard the 2nd batch of 5 collators on Centrifuge.
details: Increasing number of collators will help to decentralize the collator set, so we voted AYE on this.
